main_definition: To be in accordance with fact or reality; genuinely, sincerely.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to emphasize the honesty and sincerity of a statement.
meanings_and_examples.example: I truly believe that you can achieve anything you set your mind to.
Truly, this is an amazing accomplishment!

meanings_and_examples.definition: Denoting something as genuine and authentic.
meanings_and_examples.example: The painting was truly a masterpiece; it seemed to come straight from the artist's heart.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to express that one is convinced about certain facts or truth.
meanings_and_examples.example: Truly, I have no doubt about her skills and talent.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Conveying a sense of deep conviction or strong faith in something.
meanings_and_examples.example: He truly trusted that things would work out for the best.
